Quiet queer spaces

Taking inspiration from Hannah Gadsby‚Äôs ideas on (neuro)diversity in the queer community, I‚Äôve come to understand that the audience for the queer facilitation I do can be best identified as The Quiet Gays:

Both within the context of queer Catholicism and in queerdom in general, I‚Äôve experienced a growing pull away from the things I normally appreciate: sincerity, a sense of community, and daylight. For many young queer people, the queer community can, as a false monolith, present itself as an event that happens one week or month a year during the day, and every weekend at night.

Eager to let me know what you think? Email me a reply or send a webmention.

Okay good talk.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She has a keen interest in (digital) humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking.
